sections.heading: 〜ない (nai) Usage
sections.content:
ない is one of the most versatile and important forms in Japanese, serving as the casual negative ending for verbs while also functioning as an い-adjective. Understanding its various uses is crucial for natural Japanese.

Multiple functions: 1. Verb negation: 食べない 2. い-adjective: くない 3. Independent adjective: ない 4. Compound expressions Highly versatile Essential form

children.heading: Basic negation
children.content: 食べない "don't eat" 行かない "don't go" する → しない "don't do" 来る → 来ない (こない) "don't come" Most common usage Casual negative Daily speech

children.heading: Conjugates like adjectives
children.content: ない conjugates as い-adjective: Present: ない Past: なかった Te-form: なくて Conditional: なければ Adverbial: なく Not verb conjugation Adjectival pattern Important distinction

children.heading: "Not exist / don't have"
children.content: お金がない "Have no money" 時間がない "Have no time" 問題はない "There's no problem" From verb ある Irregular negative Very common

children.heading: Following ない
children.content: 食べないよ "don't eat (emphasis)" 行かないね "don't go, right?" しないで "without doing / don't do" 来ないから "because won't come" Particles attach naturally Modify meaning Add nuance

children.heading: Two main uses
children.content: 1. Without doing: 食べないで寝た "Slept without eating" 2. Don't do (request): 食べないで "Don't eat" Same form Context shows meaning Common pattern

children.heading: Te-form usage
children.content: Connecting reason: 高くなくて便利 "Not expensive and convenient" Because: 面白くなくて退屈した "Because it wasn't interesting, got bored" Conjunction Reason giving Natural connector

children.heading: If not
children.content: 行かなければならない "Must go" (if don't go, won't do) 食べなければ "If don't eat" 見なければ分からない "Won't know unless see" Conditional form Obligation expression Common pattern

children.heading: Must do
children.content: 勉強しないといけない "Must study" 行かないといけない "Must go" やらないといけない "Must do" Obligation Necessity Casual "must"

children.heading: Must do (formal)
children.content: 勉強しなくてはならない "Must study" 行かなくてはならない "Must go" More formal than ないといけない Written language Official contexts

children.heading: Must do (variation)
children.content: 宿題をしなくてはいけない "Must do homework" 起きなくてはいけない "Must wake up" Similar to ならない Slightly less formal Common variation

children.heading: Double negative
children.content: 行かないわけではない "It's not that I won't go" 嫌いなわけではない "It's not that I dislike it" Softening Indirect expression Weak affirmative

children.heading: Even if not
children.content: 雨が降らなくても "Even if it doesn't rain" 分からなくても "Even if don't understand" Concessive "Even if not" meaning Common conditional

children.heading: Before / while not
children.content: 忘れないうちに "Before forgetting / while still remember" 終わらないうちに "Before finishing" Timing expression Preventive action

sections.heading: なければいけない Short Forms

children.heading: Casual contractions
children.content: Formal: なければいけない Casual: なきゃいけない Very casual: なきゃ 行かなければ → 行かなきゃ 食べなければ → 食べなきゃ Contracted forms Spoken Japanese Natural speech

children.heading: Won't you? / Isn't it?
children.content: 行かないか "Won't you go?" 面白くないか "Isn't it interesting?" Casual question Seeking confirmation Invitation form

children.heading: Might not
children.content: 行かないかもしれない "Might not go" できないかもしれない "Might not be able to" Uncertainty Possibility of not Hedging

children.heading: Probably won't
children.content: 来ないだろう "Probably won't come" 雨は降らないだろう "Probably won't rain" Prediction Negative expectation Speculation

children.heading: Seems not to
children.content: 分からないようだ "Seems not to understand" 来ないようだ "Seems won't come" Appearance Observation Inference

children.heading: Doesn't look like
children.content: 雨が降らなさそう "Doesn't look like it will rain" 来なさそう "Doesn't look like (they'll) come" Appearance-based Expectation Visual assessment

children.heading: Don't want to
children.content: 食べたくない "Don't want to eat" 行きたくない "Don't want to go" 見たくない "Don't want to see" Negative desire Personal preference Common expression

children.heading: Better not to
children.content: 食べないほうがいい "Better not to eat" 行かないほうがいい "Better not to go" Advice Recommendation Suggesting restraint

children.heading: Dialect forms
children.content: Standard: 食べない Kansai: 食べへん Hiroshima: 食べん Tohoku: 食べね Regional differences All mean "don't eat" Standard most universal

children.heading: Style differences
children.content: Written: 食べない (standard) Spoken with particles: 食べないよ (emphasis) 食べないね (confirmation) 食べないか (question) Particles add natural flow Spoken language features

children.heading: Strengthening negation
children.content: 全然食べない "don't eat at all" 全く分からない "don't understand at all" 絶対に行かない "absolutely won't go" 決して忘れない "never forget" Emphatic adverbs Strengthening denial Common intensifiers

sections.heading: Common Mistakes
sections.content: ❌ Using as verb conjugation ない functions as い-adjective ✓ Use adjectival patterns なかった, なくて, なければ ❌ Confusing ないで and なくて Different functions ✓ Learn distinctions ないで = without/don't なくて = connector/because ❌ Wrong conditional form ✗ ないたら ✓ Correct form ✓ なければ ❌ Forgetting contractions in speech Sounds unnatural ✓ Use natural forms なきゃ、なくちゃ in casual speech Master versatility Understand all uses Practice in context

children.heading: Real-life usage
children.content: お金がない "Have no money" まだ分からない "Don't understand yet" 行かなくてはならない "Must go" 食べないで "Don't eat / Without eating" 雨が降らないといいね "Hope it doesn't rain" 忘れないうちにメモする "Take notes before forgetting" そんなに難しくない "Not that difficult" 行かなきゃ "Gotta go" 全然問題ない "No problem at all" できないわけではない "It's not that I can't do it" Various contexts Multiple functions Daily expressions Natural usage Essential patterns Common speech Versatile form
